trial_identification.studytitle: Different protocols for children in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) : general anesthesia, sedation or none?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Different protocols for children in Magnetic Resonance (MRI) imaging: general anesthesia, sedation or none? A retrospective analysis of patient records

conditions.healthcondition: We will search techniques used in children undergoing brain, thorax, abdomen or vertebral MRI

interventions.interventions: We will retrospectively search the patient files to determine the technique used in children undergoing MRI such as general anesthesia, sedation or behavioral approaches in our hospital from February 2012-August 2012.
interventions.comparator: We will evaluate the anesthesia records retrospectively. There is no control group.

primaryOutcome.outcome: We will retrospectively analyse the children's medical records who attended to practice MRI to detect if they had general anesthesia, sedation or behavioral approaches in our hospital from February 2012 to August 2012.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From August 12/2013 to august 22/2013, we want to retrospectively analyse the records of children who attended MRI between February to August 2012.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Children 0-16 years age receiving MRI from February 2012-August 2012.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients older than 16 years, MRI before February 2012- after August 2012. patients having fever or full stomach

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Gozde Bumin Aydin Orun villalari 2764. sok no 7 Cayyolu Ankara 06610 Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Reasearch Hospital

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Orun villalari 2764. sok no 7 Cayyolu Ankara 06610

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Giving anesthesia outside the operation room, expecially in MRI is a serious anxiety for anesthesiologists. Most of the adults and children are afraid of recieving MRI also children has %20 of unexpected complications in recieving general anesthesia in MRI. We want to retrospectively evaluate the records of children(0-16 years old) if they had general anesthesia, sedation or behavioral therapy in February to August 2012 while practising MRI in our hospital.
